railway.network

Class Route

  • java.lang.Object
    • railway.network.Route

  • public class Route
extends java.lang.Object

    Class to store and calculate Route information on a given Network.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Route

        public Route(int routeID,
             int source,
             int destination,
             Network network)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        routeID - The route ID
        source - The source
        destination - The destination
        network - The whole network
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no route can be calculated or if Route ID already exists or Network is null or source/destination IDs don't refer to real Signal.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateRoute

        public void calculateRoute()

        Calculate the blocks needed to reach the destination from the source.

        Controller method for the recursive calcNextNeighbour() method.

      • setInterlocking

        public void setInterlocking()

        Set the Point and Signal interlocking settings.

        Uses the interlocking tables generated by RouteConflict to set Points and Signals.

      • setRouteID

        public void setRouteID(int routeID)

        Set the Route's ID.

        Parameters:
        routeID - int to set as the ID of this Route.

      • getRouteID

        public int getRouteID()

        Get the Route's ID.

        Returns:
        int ID of this Route.

      • getSource

        public Signal getSource()

        Get the Route's source.

        Returns:
        Signal which is the Route's source

      • getDestination

        public Signal getDestination()

        Get the Route's destination.

        Returns:
        Signal which is the Route's destination

      • getBlocks

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getBlocks()

        Get the list of Blocks in the Route.

        Returns:
        a list of blocks

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()

        Get the direction that this Route goes in to get to the destination.

        Returns:
        Direction of travel for this Route.
